ref: 6293 dārá2 m. pl. ʻ wife ʼ Gr̥S., m. sg. Āp., f. sg. BhP. 2. dārikā -- f. ʻ girl ʼ Hariv., ʻ harlot ʼ lex. [If orig. meaning was ʻ house ʼ (EWA ii 36 with lit.) then *grāmadāra -- is ʻ having his home in a village ʼ which is borne out by meanings in NIA.]
Pa. dāra -- m., ˚rā -- f. (sg. or pl.) ʻ a wife ʼ;

lang: Aśokan, i.e. the language of the Inscriptions of Aśoka
ref: kāl. puta -- dāle ʻ son and wife ʼ;
kāl. puta -- dāle ʻ son and wife ʼ;

lang: MIA. forms occurring in Corpus Inscriptionum Indicarum Vol. II Pt. 1
ref: KharI. sa -- putra -- darasa gen. sg. ʻ with son and wife ʼ;
Pk. dāra -- m.n. ʻ wife, woman ʼ;
